text: my very favorite part of 4th of July has
to be the fireworks display when the Sun
Goes Down and I have a really delicious
and addictive snack that's gonna set
fireworks off in your mouth they're
perfect for the fourth of July but
they're so delicious you're gonna want
to make them all year long and they only
have five ingredients you start with two
tablespoons of unsalted butter a little
maple syrup for sweetness that's a
quarter cup into the pot with the butter
and that heat comes from my favorite hot
sauce sriracha
you'll want about three tablespoons a
little more a little less depending on
your tolerance for heat and of course
you have to have the cracker and in this
case I'm using or Easter crackers I love
them because they can really absorb
liquid and keep their crunch and they
have a mild buttery flavor very neutral
so they're perfect for any flavor
combination okay get this onto a high
flame we just want it to come to a boil
while you're doing this pre-heat your
oven to 275 degrees we're nearly there
starting to see some bubbles along the
edges of the pot you also want to have
your oyster crackers at the ready this
is four cups of oyster crackers from an
eight ounce box okay here we go it's
coming to a boil all right so we can
turn that off the heat add the oyster
crackers in and give it a stir to evenly
coat also for something a little
aromatic and herbaceous thyme sprigs
fresh I have six of them here give them
a quick rub between your hands
briefly to release the oils a bit and
let some of those leaves fall off and
then just chuck them all in and give it
another good stir and these crackers are
just soaking up this mixture like a
sponge and of course they'll dry out
again as they bake in the oven and
become crispy and crunchy once more now
I'm making a relatively small batch if
you're gonna throw a party you could
double triple quadruple this recipe
really the only rule is that you have
the crackers spread out into a single
layer on your tray speaking of have a
rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment
paper and just skitter these out onto
the tray
they already smell like something you
won't be able to stop
and just spread this out evenly into a
single layer and these will need 45
minutes approximately in the oven stir
them a few times maybe every 10 or 15
minutes our fiery crackers are cooled
and crisp and ready to devour the
perfect accompaniment for something like
this I think it's a nice cool beer one
bite I'm telling you and you will not be
